results.title: The Group
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
The progress of 5 people in an intensive group socialisation therapy in a London psychiatric hospital. The film is useful for training of psychologists, group therapists and social workers

results.title: The Dumping grounds
results.creator_credit: John Shepherd, Leslie Woodhead and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
Looks at the issue of the makeshift Bantu reservations to which the South African Government is transporting whole communities in furtherance of its “separate development” policy. Reveals an appalling catalogue of mismanagement and neglect on the part of those responsible for this mass transportation of people - and on the Bantu side a total crushing despair.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Shepherd, Leslie Woodhead and Granada Television International

results.title: Doctors' orders
results.creator_credit: Colin Richards and Granada International Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
After the publication of a report on prescribing in general practice, the program looks at the reasons for over-prescribing and talks to several general practitioners who feel they are being pressurised by both patients and drug companies into this expensive and potentially dangerous situation.
results.description:

results.title: Do you mind if I smoke?
results.creator_credit: Sue Woodford and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
Investigates the dangers of passive smoking, ie the smoke inhaled by a non-smoker from cigarettes left burning in an ashtray or in someone’s hand. Suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: A Dignified exit
results.creator_credit: Brian Blake and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
Examines the moral and legal issues involved in the future publication of a manual describing ‘How to commit suicide effectively’ to be published by EXIT- The Society for the Right to Die with Dignity, and also hears the views of three women who have known great suffering through ill-health.
results.description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
Examines the moral and legal issues involved in the future publication of a manual describing ‘How to commit suicide effectively’ to be published by EXIT- The Society for the Right to Die with Dignity, and also hears the views of three women who have known great suffering through ill-health.

results.title: The Demonstration
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
An award-winning episode of the ‘World in Action’ series observing the mass protest at the U.S. embassy in London against the bombing of North Vietnam. Interviews students travelling to the rally, police preparing for the confrontation and members of the public expressing their support or opposition to the event. Captures the violent clashes between police and the crowd and records the media coverage that was transmitted by American reporters.
results.description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
An award-winning episode of the ‘World in Action’ series observing the mass protest at the U.S. embassy in London against the bombing of North Vietnam. Interviews students travelling to the rally, police preparing for the confrontation and members of the public expressing their support or opposition to the event. Captures the violent clashes between police and the crowd and records the media coverage that was transmitted by American reporters.

Captures the violent clashes between police and the crowd and records the media coverage that was transmitted by American reporters.

results.title: Death by request
results.creator_credit: Michael Ryan and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
Meg Murray, an incurably ill patient, puts the case for euthanasia. Rather than spend her last days in an old persons’ home she says she will commit suicide. She discusses her attitude and views with another individual who does not agree with her.

results.title: The Cancer gas
results.creator_credit: Alan Segal and Granada International Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
Vinyl chloride monomer is a gas used in the making of PVC - one of the most common forms of plastic. Scientists now believe that workmen breathing the fumes of VCM can contract cancer of the liver.

results.title: Yoshiko the Papermaker (Japan)
results.creator_credit: Paul Saltzman, Deepa Mehta and Sunrise Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World cultures and youth”.
Yoshiko Fujimoto, thirteen, lives in the tiny mountain village of Obara-Mura which retains its seven hundred year old traditions for unique handmade paper panels. Yoshiko learns this ancient art from a local master.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Saltzman, Deepa Mehta and Sunrise Films
